intro: Seubertia laxa, commonly known as the slender seubertia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are linear and slightly hairy, while its yellow flowers are arranged in clusters. Seubertia laxa is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
